hey @Ivorforce,
while building the project I was running into this issue
`In file included from src/ndarray.cpp:1:
In file included from src/ndarray.h:23:
src/vatensor/varray.h:14:10: fatal error: 'xtensor/xarray.hpp' file not found
#include "xtensor/xarray.hpp"           // for xarray_adaptor
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
scons: *** [src/ndarray.os] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.`

I have written a basic structure for the rounding functions but can't test because of this failure. Can you help me out with this?
TIA
Hi, try compiling again. It usually fails on the first try. (see #23)
still getting the same error, I see this is a recent change

I think the includes may fail on any (random) xtensor include. Due to #23, it does not reliably set up the 3 dependencies (xtl, xtensor, xsimd).

Try the following in your command line manually:

```
# in numdot folder
cd xtl/build && cmake ../ && cmake --install . --prefix .
# back to numbot folder
cd xsimd/build && cmake ../ -DENABLE_XTL_COMPLEX=1 -Dxtl_DIR='../xtl/build/ && cmake --install . --prefix .
# back to numdot folder
cd xtensor/build && cmake ../ -DXTENSOR_USE_XSIMD=1 -Dxtl_DIR='../xtl/build/' -Dxsimd_DIR='../xsimd/build/' && cmake --install . --prefix .
```

This basically replicates what SConstruct is supposed to do.
Anyway, I was able to run it. Compiled fine without any tests, code looks good. I'll adjust includes and docs post-merge. Thanks!

Reading up on the differences between rint and nearbyint, i'm deleting nearbyint and using nearbyint for the rint implementation. As i understand, rint raises when it actually had to perform rounding, which is not really useful in vectorized cases.

@Krishn1412 I was attempting to build this on Windows 10 w/ mingw and faced the same issue. I ended up resolving it by manually building the three dependencies as mentioned above, and then removed those subcommands from the SConstruct file before running it again.

edit: we traced the issue to the fact that powershell doesn't recognize `&&` and deletes the tmp file (xtl.hpp for example) when that command fails.
I just removed the cmake steps from SConstruct and just added the include dirs to the project. Found no difference so far. Hopefully this eliminates these issues for good.
yup makes sense, we won't be needing rint here
